description: Taste patterns for OBDN project - learned from user feedback on design decisions

patterns.title: Premium Card Typography
patterns.context: premium card design, dashboard cards, data visualization
patterns.strategy: Use Domaine Sans Display ≥28px for card titles, Supreme LL 400 for data labels, gold accent only on data values
patterns.evidence: User prefers Domaine Sans at larger sizes (28px+) for premium feel. Gold restraint (<10%) maintains luxury impact.

patterns.title: Bento Grid Structure
patterns.context: dashboard layout, multi-card views, responsive grids
patterns.strategy: Use Rule 9d compliant bento grid: no wrapper divs, direct children only, flexible spacer row for footer alignment
patterns.evidence: Rule 9d is INSTANT-FAIL critical rule. User demands perfect internal alignment across sibling cards.

patterns.title: Spacing Grid Discipline
patterns.strategy: All spacing must be multiples of 4px base grid. Use design tokens (var(--space-X)) not arbitrary values.
patterns.evidence: User has zero tolerance for random spacing (17px, 23px, 35px). Mathematical precision required.

patterns.title: Gold Accent Restraint
patterns.strategy: AVOID using gold accent for more than 10% of screen elements. Reserve for data values, CTAs, active states only.
patterns.evidence: Overusing gold destroys luxury feel. User rejects designs with gold on all headings, large backgrounds, or decorative borders.

patterns.title: Dark Background Foundation
patterns.strategy: Use #0c051c as primary background. Layer surfaces with white opacity (2% → 3% → 5% for subtle → base → raised).
patterns.evidence: OBDN brand identity is dark luxury. Light mode variations rejected.

learning_notes: This playbook learns from design feedback signals logged in .orchestration/signals/signal-log.jsonl
orchestration-reflector analyzes design outcomes and identifies new patterns
playbook-curator updates helpful_count/harmful_count based on user feedback
Patterns with harmful_count > helpful_count × 3 enter apoptosis (7-day grace period)
New patterns appended when novel taste preferences discovered

integration.curator: playbook-curator updates counts and detects taste drift
